Fit TOP model

Source: R/fit_TOP_models.R
fit_TOP_M5_model.Rd

Fit TOP model (using M5 bins) for selected partitions in parallel.

fit_TOP_M5_model(
  all_training_data,
  all_training_data_files,
  model.file,
  logistic.model = FALSE,
  transform = c("asinh", "log2", "sqrt", "none"),
  partitions = 1:10,
  n.iter = 2000,
  n.burnin = floor(n.iter/2),
  n.chains = 3,
  n.thin = max(1, floor((n.iter - n.burnin)/1000)),
  n.cores = length(partitions),
  return.result = c("samples", "jagsfit"),
  save = TRUE,
  out.dir = "./TOP_samples",
  quiet = FALSE
)

Arguments

all_training_data

A list of the assembled training data of all partitions.

all_training_data_files

A vector of the assembled training data files of all partitions. If all_training_data is missing, it will load the training data from all_training_data_files.

model.file

TOP model file written in JAGS.

logistic.model

Logical; if TRUE, use the logistic version of TOP model.

transform

Type of transformation for ChIP counts. Possible values are "asinh", "log2", "sqrt", and "none" (no transformation). Only needed when logistic.model is FALSE.

partitions

A vector of selected partition(s) to run. (default: all 10 partitions (1:10))

n.iter

Number of total iterations per chain (including burn in).

n.burnin

Length of burn in samples, i.e. number of iterations to discard at the beginning. Default is n.iter/2, that is, discarding the first half of the simulations.

n.chains

Number of Markov chains (default: 3).

n.thin

Thinning rate, must be a positive integer. Default is max(1, floor(n.chains * (n.iter-n.burnin) / 1000)) which will only thin if there are at least 2000 simulations.

n.cores

Number of cores to use in parallel (default: equal to the number of partitions).

save

Logical, if TRUE, save posterior samples as .rds files in out.dir.

out.dir

Directory to save TOP model posterior samples.

quiet

Logical, whether to suppress stdout in jags.model().

Value

A list of posterior samples for each of the partitions.

Contents

Developed by Kaixuan Luo, Jianling Zhong, Alex Hartemink.
